page.title: 20Pulham Village
page.content: The whole of Pulham village is on the surveyed block.Written as"Poleham" in the Domesday Book,its priest is named as"Rainbaldus".Canning's Court nearby, thought to be a corruption of Canons' (or monks')Court was the seat of the Halsey family for 300 years. Decimated by the Black Death,Pulham moved to clean ground,further from the church.Traces of deserted dwellings can still be seen.Derelict houses are remembered at Pulham Lake,a marshy once unenclosed area,now under plough. There is some industry in Pulham.A saw mill produces pallets,posts,gates and fences;and a factory makes steel structures to be used in building. Built in 1950,the village hall is in constant use.The Post Office(run by the Boyt family for 66 years from their council house)is the centre of village life.
